intro: Elaeagnus rotundifolia, commonly known as silver berry, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Asia. It is characterized by its silvery-gray leaves and small, yellowish fruits that ripen in late summer. The plant has a deep root system that helps stabilize soil and prevent erosion. It is also known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and its tolerance to drought. Elaeagnus rotundifolia is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
